title: JavaScript Numbers & Math
subject: JavaScript
theory:
JavaScript has only one type of number. It can be written with or without decimals.

The `Math` object allows you to perform mathematical tasks on numbers.
syntax:
let pi = 3.14;
Math.round(4.7); // 5
Math.floor(4.9); // 4
Math.random(); // 0 to 1

examples.explanation: toFixed returns a string with specified decimals.

interview_questions.question: How to generate a random integer between 1 and 10?

real_world_use_cases.description: Always use `.toFixed(2)` when displaying prices to ensure 2 decimal places.

exam_notes: Infinity and -Infinity are possible number values.
Everything derived from calculation with NaN is NaN.
summary: Numbers are usually straightforward, but floating point precision and the Math library are deep topics.
